physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features two women and one man. The man is seated on a ledge. The woman on the right is hugging him from behind. The woman on the left is kneeling on one ground, with her right hand on his lap. They seem to be outside a housing structure. The photograph is quite faded, with black spots all over.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of two women and one man by a house
